headline.main: Knockout Punch; AIR POWER AND TOTAL WAR. By Cy Caldwell. 244 pp. New York: Coward-McCann, Inc. $2.50. By LT. (jg) ELTING MORISON, USNR

lead_paragraph: THE extravagant claims made by both sides in the debate that raged from 1920 to 1940 over the place of the airplane in modern war derived, in large part, from the fact that the bitter discussion was conducted in a military vacuum.
abstract: Morison, E; Air Power and Total War
snippet: THE extravagant claims made by both sides in the debate that raged from 1920 to 1940 over the place of the airplane in modern war derived, in large part, from the fact that the bitter discussion was conducted in a military vacuum....
